summary: This document contains email exchanges between Jeffrey Epstein and 'Gmax' (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) from 2009 and 2015. The 2009 emails discuss legal concerns about being served with a subpoena related to a lawsuit, with Epstein advising on protective orders. The 2015 email shows Epstein encouraging Maxwell to maintain a public presence and mentions a Swedish ocean ambassador.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Email sender/recipient, subject of legal discussion
persons.context: Communicates with Gmax about legal strategy regarding a subpoena and later encourages her to act confidently in public. He references his own legal situation and connections.

persons.name: Gmax
persons.role: Email recipient/sender, person concerned about legal service
persons.context: Expresses concern about being served a subpoena related to Jeffrey Epstein and seeks his advice. Later corresponds about public perception.

persons.name: Lisa Svenson
persons.context: Mentioned by Epstein as having stated that no one on her ocean panel takes 'this stuff' seriously and that Gmax would be welcome at ocean conferences.

connections.description: Direct email correspondence discussing legal strategies, subpoenas, and public relations advice. Epstein is giving guidance to Gmax.
Epstein mentions having had Lisa Svenson, the Swedish ocean ambassador, over recently and relays her comments about Gmax.
Epstein relays that Lisa Svenson said Gmax would be welcome at ocean/water conferences, indicating a potential social or professional connection.

events.title: Attempted service of subpoena at Gmax's house
events.description: A person came to Gmax's house attempting to serve a subpoena that had 'jane doe' and Gmax's name on it, related to a lawsuit involving Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Epstein advises on protective order strategy
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein emails Gmax advising they can file a protective order to prevent her from having to testify, claiming she was 'nowhere near the person during the relevant dates.'

events.title: Gmax seeks statement about girlfriend timeline
events.description: Gmax emails Epstein, stating she would appreciate it if 'it' would come out and say 'she' was his girlfriend from end of 1999 to 2002.

events.title: Epstein encourages public confidence
events.description: Epstein responds to Gmax, urging her to 'start acting like it. go outside, head high, not as an escaping convict. go to parties. deal with it.' and mentions his contact with Lisa Svenson.

keyFacts: In 2009, Gmax was concerned about being served a subpoena related to a lawsuit involving Jeffrey Epstein, indicating she was a person of interest in ongoing legal proceedings.
Jeffrey Epstein advised Gmax on a legal strategy to avoid testifying by filing a protective order claiming she was 'nowhere near the person during the relevant dates.'
In 2015, Gmax sought Epstein's help in having someone publicly state she was his girlfriend from late 1999 to 2002, suggesting a defined personal relationship during that period.

Epstein's 2015 email encourages Gmax to maintain a confident public facade ('not as an escaping convict') and mentions that a Swedish ocean ambassador, Lisa Svenson, downplayed the seriousness of 'this stuff' and welcomed Gmax to conferences.
The email footer claims the communication is confidential, may be attorney-client privileged, and is the property of 'JEE' (Jeffrey E. Epstein), indicating a formal attempt to shield communications.
